description: From Middle English attender, attendere, equivalent to attend +‎ -er.

entries.meaning: An attendee; one who attends a course, meeting, school, etc.
examples: She was a very constant attender of First-day and week-day meetings, at the meeting places she belonged to

entries.meaning: An attendant; one who attends to someone or something.
examples: Sri C. Rajabather was appointed to assist in the office as typist attender from 7-4-41.
the whole process of ages’-long mentalization, of which our present ability of conceiving “Mind” forms only the culmination, and by no means the constant attender.
